Never said it didn't exist. My point was, purple can not be a single pure frequency of light as it doesn't appear on the visible spectrum - unlike violet which does.
What we perceive to be purple is a mixture of colours, usually a form of red and blue. In the case of the onion, the pigmentation is predominantly red, hence the name 'red onion'.

Purple is a non-spectral colour as it doesn't have its own wavelength of light, so it's technically a 'fake' colour. The pigment of the onion *is* red, it just appears to be purple.
